ygData.msgSnippet: Well, I m happy with my Druid Island scenario, with the druids only being experience level 9.  I m modifying the number of druids, though. One thing puzzles

From: "Daniel Paul Hightower" <dph_of_rules@...>

Well, I'm happy with my 'Druid Island' scenario, with the druids only 
being experience level 9.  I'm modifying the number of druids, though. 
  One thing puzzles me, though.  I disturbed the druids evenly across 
the width of the scenario.  But the right side ends almost completely 
covered in trees, while the left side is scarcely populated with 
trees.  This is before I use 'Taunt' attack to bring the faeries to me 
 so I can take most of them out with a single bomb.  Incidently, using 
anchored 'Poison Clous' also is a pretty effective means of population 
control (once started with 500+ and by using anchored Poison Clouds 
ended up with under 400 opponents).  

This scenario is indeed working out to be exactly what I want.  Too 
bad, I can't incorporate it into my legitimate scenarios.  In order to 
make it work like I wanted it to, I had to isolate the druids from the 
player team by lots of water (a definite no-no for legitimate because 
 you would have to cheat in order win.)  Wait a minute, I guess I need 
to try to beat it legitimately with a legitimate team (I have only 1 
legitimate team.)
